snippet: Documents examined by a Senate committee portray a White House that approved the brutal questioning of suspects but was repeatedly misled about the program.
abstract: Senate Intelligence Committee report on CIA interrogation and torture of terrorism detainees raises questions about what Pres Bush knew and what CIA told him about program; Bush and other veterans of his administration say they were not misled about program; report contrasts with Bush's account of program's origin in spring 2002.
lead_paragraph: Documents examined by a Senate committee portray a White House that approved the brutal questioning of suspects but was repeatedly misled about the program.

headline.main: Bush Team Approved C.I.A. Tactics, but Was Kept in Dark on Details, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Bush Team Approved, but Was Kept in Dark on Details, Report Says
